result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard R Noll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons or any facsimile weapon.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Kwik Trip listed in the Criminal Complaint and with Paul P. listed in Case 15CM191.
Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.

Cash bail applied.  Balance of court costs are to be paid as a condition of probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Same conditions for probation apply as to Count 1.
Cases 14CM2005, 14CM2030 and 15CM190 were dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order for Early Termination of Probation, signed and filed. Probation may terminate on 07/15/2016
Request for early probation discharge. Submitted by Probation Agent Krajcir.  Sent to Judge Carter for review.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Leonard R Noll in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 & 2.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Not to Use or Possess any dangerous weapons or any facsimile weapon   
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: Kwik Trip listed in criminal complaint and with Paul P. listed in Case #15CM191

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted on Case #15CM190 ($250.00) - remainder to be applied to costs on Count #2)


COUNT #2:   WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Not to Use or Possess any dangerous weapons or any facsimile weapon   
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: Kwik Trip listed in criminal complaint and with Paul P. listed in Case #15CM191

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid out of remaining cash bail posted on Case #15CM190  - and remainder due as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED (to be used at agent's discretion)
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

All other cases to tag along. Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
